message: Must produce a portable environment so it can be used at home and work.
I use vundle for plugins, etc. and keep configs in git. That way I can clone my setup on any machine and it's ready to go.
The company I work with, EdgeCase, keeps our vim config at github. Might be a good place to start if you're doing similar things. Github.com/EdgeCase/vim-config

I like pathogen (https://github.com/tpope/vim-pathogen). I keep my configs at github, and the plugins are just git submodules, so setting up my environment in a new machine is just a matter of cloning the repository and running 'git submodule update --init --recursive'

I used to use pathogen but now prefer vundle as it allows me to see which plugins I have installed just by looking at my .vimrc file. Submodule handling happened to be a bit too cumbersome when it comes to uninstall a plugin.
I'll have to give vundle a try.
